title: Authors and Citation
text: Almeida G, Vieira M (2024). fableCount: INGARCH GLARMA Models Count Time Series Fable Framework. R package version 0.1.0, https://gustavo039.github.io/fableCount/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {fableCount: INGARCH and GLARMA Models for Count Time Series in Fable Framework},   author = {Gustavo Almeida and Marcel Vieira},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://gustavo039.github.io/fableCount/}, }

title: Estimate a GLARMA model — GLARMA
text: Estimate Generalized Linear Autoregressive Moving Average  model Poisson Negative Binomial distribution. Also provide automatic parameter algorithm selection Autorregressive Moving Average params

title: Estimate a GLARMA model — GLARMA
code: GLARMA(   formula,   ic = c("aic", "bic"),   distr = c("Poi", "NegBin"),   method = c("FS", "NR"),   residuals = c("Pearson", "Score"),   trace = FALSE )

title: Estimate a GLARMA model — GLARMA
text: formula Model specification (see "Specials" section). ic Character, can 'AIC','BIC'. information criterion used selecting model. distr Character, can 'poisson' 'nbinom'. probabilty distribution used generalized model method Character, can 'FS' (Fisher scoring) 'NR' (Newton-Raphson). method iteration used residuals Character, can 'Pearson' 'Score'. type residuals used trace Logical. automatic parameter algorithm runnig, print path best model estimation

title: Estimate a GLARMA model — GLARMA
text: model specification.

title: Estimate a GLARMA model — GLARMA
text: pq defines non-seasonal autoregressive moving avarages terms, can define user, omited, automatic parameter selection algorithm trigered automatic parameter selection algorithm gonna fit best model based information criterion

title: Estimate a GLARMA model — GLARMA
text: PQ defines seasonal autoregressive moving avarages terms, can define user, omited, automatic parameter selection algorithm trigered ('arma_to_GLARMA' algorithm) automatic parameter selection algorithm gonna fit best model based information criterion

title: Estimate a GLARMA model — GLARMA
text: Exogenous regressors can included GLARMA model without explicitly using `xreg()` special. Common exogenous regressor specials specified [`common_xregs`] can also used. regressors handled using [stats::model.frame()], interactions functionality behaves similarly [stats::lm()]. inclusion constant model follows similar rules [`stats::lm()`], including `1` add constant `0` `-1` remove constant. left , inclusion constant determined minimising `ic`. xreg provided, model forecast avaliable
code: xreg(..., fixed = list())

title: Estimate a GLARMA model — GLARMA
code: # Manual GLARMA specification tsibbledata::aus_production |>   fabletools::model(manual_gla = GLARMA(Beer ~ pq(1,0))) #> # A mable: 1 x 1 #>       manual_gla #>          <model> #> 1 <GLARMA(1, 0)>  # Automatic GLARMA specification tsibbledata::aus_production |>   fabletools::model(auto_gla = GLARMA(Beer, ic = 'aic')) #> Warning: 1 error encountered for auto_gla #> [1] The automatic selection algorithm failed to find stable parameters #> # A mable: 1 x 1 #>       auto_gla #>        <model> #> 1 <NULL model>

title: Estimate a INGARCH model — INGARCH
text: Estimate Integer-valued Generalized Autoregressive Conditional Heteroscedasticity model Poisson Negative Binomial distribution. Also provide automatic parameter algorithm selection Autorregressive Moving Avarege params

title: Estimate a INGARCH model — INGARCH
code: INGARCH(   formula,   ic = c("aic", "bic", "qic"),   link = c("identity", "log"),   distr = c("poisson", "nbinom"),   algorithm = c("naive_search", "arma_to_ingarch"),   trace = FALSE )

title: Estimate a INGARCH model — INGARCH
text: formula Model specification (see "Specials" section). ic Character, can 'aic' 'bic' 'qic'. information criterion used selecting model. link Character, can 'identity' 'log' link function used generalized model distr Character, can 'poisson' 'nbinom'. probabilty distribution used generalized model algorithm Character, specifies automatic parameter selection algorithm. Can 'naive_search' 'arma_to_ingarch'. 'naive_search' selected, search 4x4 matrix parameter space performed, model minimize criterion value selected. 'arma_to_ingarch' selected, uses auto_arma starting point selection algorithm. ‘arma_to_ingarch’ one perform seasonal adjustment trace Logical. automatic parameter algorithm runnig, print path best model estimation

title: Estimate a INGARCH model — INGARCH
text: model specification.

title: Estimate a INGARCH model — INGARCH
text: xreg provided, model forecast avaliable
code: xreg(..., fixed = list())

title: Estimate a INGARCH model — INGARCH
text: pq defines non-seasonal autoregressive moving avarages terms, can define user, omited, automatic parameter selection algorithm trigered automatic parameter selection algorithm gonna fit best model based information criterion

title: Estimate a INGARCH model — INGARCH
text: PQ defines seasonal autoregressive moving avarages terms, can define user, omited, automatic parameter selection algorithm trigered ('arma_to_ingarch' algorithm) automatic parameter selection algorithm gonna fit best model based information criterion

title: Estimate a INGARCH model — INGARCH
text: Exogenous regressors can included INGARCH model without explicitly using `xreg()` special. Common exogenous regressor specials specified [`common_xregs`] can also used. regressors handled using [stats::model.frame()], interactions functionality behaves similarly [stats::lm()]. inclusion constant model follows similar rules [`stats::lm()`], including `1` add constant `0` `-1` remove constant. left , inclusion constant determined minimising `ic`.

title: Estimate a INGARCH model — INGARCH
code: # \donttest{ # Manual INGARCH specification tsibbledata::aus_production |>   fabletools::model(manual_ing = INGARCH(Beer ~ pq(1,1))) #> p q  #> 1 1  #> # A mable: 1 x 1 #>        manual_ing #>           <model> #> 1 <INGARCH(1, 1)>  # Automatic INGARCH specification  tsibbledata::aus_production |> fabletools::model(auto_ing_naive =                     INGARCH(Beer,                             ic = 'aic',                             trace = TRUE,                            algorithm = 'naive_search'),                   auto_ing_arm_ing =                     INGARCH(Beer,                             ic = 'aic',                             trace = TRUE,                             algorithm = 'arma_to_ingarch')) #> INGARCH[0, 0], AIC:5735.90  #> Warning: Without dependence on past observations the dependence on past values of the #> linear predictor has no effect. Choose the model wisely. #> Warning: There is almost no serial dependence estimated in the data. This might be #> appropriate but could just as likely indicate a problem with the optimisation. Please check #> results carefully. #> INGARCH[0, 1], AIC:5737.90  #> Warning: Without dependence on past observations the dependence on past values of the #> linear predictor has no effect. Choose the model wisely. #> Warning: There is almost no serial dependence estimated in the data. This might be #> appropriate but could just as likely indicate a problem with the optimisation. Please check #> results carefully. #> INGARCH[0, 2], AIC:5739.90  #> Warning: Without dependence on past observations the dependence on past values of the #> linear predictor has no effect. Choose the model wisely. #> Warning: There is almost no serial dependence estimated in the data. This might be #> appropriate but could just as likely indicate a problem with the optimisation. Please check #> results carefully. #> INGARCH[0, 3], AIC:5741.90  #> INGARCH[1, 0], AIC:3744.19  #> INGARCH[1, 1], AIC:3140.70  #> INGARCH[1, 2], AIC:3593.77  #> INGARCH[1, 3], AIC:5712.87  #> INGARCH[2, 0], AIC:4137.00  #> INGARCH[2, 1], AIC:5669.15  #> INGARCH[2, 2], AIC:5693.49  #> INGARCH[2, 3], AIC:5706.39  #> INGARCH[3, 0], AIC:5670.90  #> INGARCH[3, 1], AIC:5653.17  #> INGARCH[3, 2], AIC:5692.41  #> INGARCH[3, 3], AIC:5731.43  #> Warning: 1 error encountered for auto_ing_arm_ing #> [1] unused arguments (link = "identity", distr = "poisson") #> p q  #> 1 1  #> # A mable: 1 x 2 #>    auto_ing_naive auto_ing_arm_ing #>           <model>          <model> #> 1 <INGARCH(1, 1)>     <NULL model>                             # }

what: Extract fitted values from a fable model — fitted.GLARMA
title: Extract fitted values from a fable model — fitted.GLARMA

title: Extract fitted values from a fable model — fitted.GLARMA
code: # S3 method for GLARMA fitted(object, ...)

title: Extract fitted values from a fable model — fitted.GLARMA
text: object model forecasts required. ... arguments passed methods

title: Extract fitted values from a fable model — fitted.GLARMA
text: vector fitted values.

title: Extract fitted values from a fable model — fitted.GLARMA
code: tsibbledata::aus_production |>   fabletools::model(manual_gla = GLARMA(Beer ~ pq(1,0))) |>   dplyr::select(manual_gla) |>   fitted() #> # A tsibble: 218 x 3 [1Q] #> # Key:       .model [1] #>    .model     Quarter .fitted #>    <chr>        <qtr>   <dbl> #>  1 manual_gla 1956 Q1    413. #>  2 manual_gla 1956 Q2    341. #>  3 manual_gla 1956 Q3    335. #>  4 manual_gla 1956 Q4    346. #>  5 manual_gla 1957 Q1    388. #>  6 manual_gla 1957 Q2    340. #>  7 manual_gla 1957 Q3    344. #>  8 manual_gla 1957 Q4    347. #>  9 manual_gla 1958 Q1    395. #> 10 manual_gla 1958 Q2    343. #> # ℹ 208 more rows

what: Forecast a model from the fable package — forecast.GLARMA
title: Forecast a model from the fable package — forecast.GLARMA
text: Produces forecasts trained model.

title: Forecast a model from the fable package — forecast.GLARMA
code: # S3 method for GLARMA forecast(object, new_data, ...)

title: Forecast a model from the fable package — forecast.GLARMA
text: object model forecasts required. new_data Tsibble, contains time points exogenous regressors produce forecasts . ... arguments passed methods

title: Forecast a model from the fable package — forecast.GLARMA
text: list forecasts.

title: Forecast a model from the fable package — forecast.GLARMA
text: Predict future observations based fitted GLM-type model time series counts. Futher informations forecast method can obtained typing ?glarma::forecast

title: Forecast a model from the fable package — forecast.GLARMA
code: tsibbledata::aus_production |>   fabletools::model(manual_gla = GLARMA(Beer ~ pq(1,0))) |>   dplyr::select(manual_gla) |>   fabletools::forecast(h = 2) #> # A fable: 2 x 4 [1Q] #> # Key:     .model [1] #>   .model     Quarter      Beer .mean #>   <chr>        <qtr>    <dist> <dbl> #> 1 manual_gla 2010 Q3 Pois(379)   379 #> 2 manual_gla 2010 Q4 Pois(380)   380

what: Forecast a model from the fable package — forecast.INGARCH
title: Forecast a model from the fable package — forecast.INGARCH
text: Produces forecasts trained model.

title: Forecast a model from the fable package — forecast.INGARCH
code: # S3 method for INGARCH forecast(object, new_data, ...)

title: Forecast a model from the fable package — forecast.INGARCH
text: object model forecasts required. new_data Tsibble, contains time points exogenous regressors produce forecasts . ... arguments passed methods

title: Forecast a model from the fable package — forecast.INGARCH
text: list forecasts.

title: Forecast a model from the fable package — forecast.INGARCH
text: Predict future observations based fitted GLM-type model time series counts. 1 step ahead, returns parametric forecast, based 'distr' param especified distribution, multiples steps forecast, distribution know analytically, uses parametric bootstrap

title: Forecast a model from the fable package — forecast.INGARCH
code: # 1 step ahead parametric forecast tsibbledata::aus_production |>   fabletools::model(manual_ing = INGARCH(Beer ~ pq(1,1) + PQ(1,1))) |>   dplyr::select(manual_ing) |>   fabletools::forecast(h = 1) #> # A fable: 1 x 4 [1Q] #> # Key:     .model [1] #>   .model     Quarter      Beer .mean #>   <chr>        <qtr>    <dist> <dbl> #> 1 manual_ing 2010 Q3 Pois(411)  411.  # Multiples steap ahead parametric bootstrap forecast tsibbledata::aus_production |>   fabletools::model(manual_ing = INGARCH(Beer ~ pq(1,1) + PQ(1,1))) |>   dplyr::select(manual_ing) |>   fabletools::forecast(h = 4) #> # A fable: 4 x 4 [1Q] #> # Key:     .model [1] #>   .model     Quarter         Beer .mean #>   <chr>        <qtr>       <dist> <dbl> #> 1 manual_ing 2010 Q3 sample[1000]  410. #> 2 manual_ing 2010 Q4 sample[1000]  411. #> 3 manual_ing 2011 Q1 sample[1000]  409. #> 4 manual_ing 2011 Q2 sample[1000]  407.

title: Glance a GLARMA model — glance.GLARMA
text: Construct single row summary GLARMA model.

title: Glance a GLARMA model — glance.GLARMA
code: # S3 method for GLARMA glance(x, ...)

title: Glance a GLARMA model — glance.GLARMA
text: data frame 1 row, columns: sigma2 unbiased variance residuals. Calculated `sum(residuals^2) / (num_observations - num_pararameters + 1)` log_lik log-likelihood AIC Akaike information criterion

title: Glance a GLARMA model — glance.GLARMA
text: x model R object convert single-row data frame ... arguments passed methods

title: Glance a GLARMA model — glance.GLARMA
text: one row tibble summarising model's fit.

title: Glance a GLARMA model — glance.GLARMA
code: tsibbledata::aus_production |>   fabletools::model(manual_ing = GLARMA(Beer ~ pq(1,1))) |>   dplyr::select(manual_ing) |>   glance() #> Warning: 1 error encountered for manual_ing #> [1] An error has occurred in the model estimation, try changing the model parameters #> # A tibble: 0 × 1 #> # ℹ 1 variable: .model <chr>

title: Glance a INGARCH model — glance.INGARCH
text: Construct single row summary INGARCH model.

title: Glance a INGARCH model — glance.INGARCH
code: # S3 method for INGARCH glance(x, ...)

title: Glance a INGARCH model — glance.INGARCH
text: data frame 1 row, columns: sigma2 unbiased variance residuals. Calculated `sum(residuals^2) / (num_observations - num_pararameters + 1)` log_lik log-likelihood AIC Akaike information criterion BIC Bayesian information criterion

title: Glance a INGARCH model — glance.INGARCH
text: x model R object convert single-row data frame ... arguments passed methods

text: one row tibble summarising model's fit.

title: Glance a INGARCH model — glance.INGARCH
code: tsibbledata::aus_production |>   fabletools::model(manual_ing = INGARCH(Beer ~ pq(1,1))) |>   dplyr::select(manual_ing) |>   glance() #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #>   .model     sigma2 log_lik   AIC   BIC #>   <chr>       <dbl>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 manual_ing  2769.  -1567. 3141. 3151.

title: Tidy a fable model — tidy.GLARMA
text: Returns coefficients model `tibble` format.

title: Tidy a fable model — tidy.GLARMA
code: # S3 method for GLARMA tidy(x, ...)

title: Tidy a fable model — tidy.GLARMA
text: x object converted tidy tibble::tibble(). ... Additional arguments tidying method.

title: Tidy a fable model — tidy.GLARMA
text: model's coefficients `tibble`.

title: Tidy a fable model — tidy.GLARMA
code: tsibbledata::aus_production |>   fabletools::model(manual_gla = GLARMA(Beer ~ pq(1,0))) |>   dplyr::select(manual_gla) |>   fabletools::tidy() #> # A tibble: 4 × 4 #>   .model     statistic  intercept      ar_1 #>   <chr>      <chr>          <dbl>     <dbl> #> 1 manual_gla estimate     6.02     0.0220   #> 2 manual_gla std_error    0.00536  0.000555 #> 3 manual_gla z_ratio   1125.      39.7      #> 4 manual_gla p_value      0        0

code: # S3 method for INGARCH tidy(x, ...)

title: Tidy a fable model — tidy.INGARCH

title: Tidy a fable model — tidy.INGARCH
code: tsibbledata::aus_production |>   fabletools::model(manual_ing = INGARCH(Beer ~ pq(1,1))) |>   dplyr::select(manual_ing) |>   fabletools::tidy() #> # A tibble: 3 × 6 #>   .model     term       estimate std.error `CI(lower)` `CI(upper)` #>   <chr>      <chr>         <dbl>     <dbl>       <dbl>       <dbl> #> 1 manual_ing (constant)    6.60     1.47         3.71        9.48  #> 2 manual_ing ar_1          0.190    0.0198       0.151       0.228 #> 3 manual_ing ma_1          0.791    0.0224       0.747       0.835
